definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Functions consist of a header and a body.
sentences.chinese: 函数由头部分和体部分组成。

sentences.english: I am very interested in your love story before, you'd better tell me a complete story.
sentences.chinese: 我好有兴趣知你噶恋爱史，最好由头到尾同我讲一次。

definition: to use as an excuse/on the pretext/excuse/pretext
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
lit. to have sufficient reason to send troops (idiom)/to do something with good reason/to have just cause
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
